title: Delhi NCR Weather: दिल्ली-एनसीआर में होगी भारी बारिश, IMD ने जारी किया रेड अलर्ट - Zee News
article_text:
रक्षाबंधन के पावन मौके पर जहां लोग बहन-भाई के प्यार का त्योहार मनाने की तैयारी में थे, वहीं बारिश ने दिल्लीवालों की तैयारियों में थोड़ा सा तड़का लगा दिया. दिल्ली-एनसीआर में लगातार 14 अगस्त लगातार बारिश का अनुमान है.
इस बीच मौसम विभाग ने दिल्ली-एनसीआर में बारिश का रेड अलर्ट भी जारी किया है. भारी बारिश का सबसे ज्यादा असर दिल्ली के निचले इलाकों में देखने को मिला. कनॉट प्लेस जैसे पॉश इलाके भी जलभराव की चपेट में आ गए, जहां सड़कें तालाब में तब्दील हो गईं.
दिल्ली में जलभराव के कारण कार चालकों और पैदल चलने वाले लोगों को परेशानी का सामना करना पड़ा.
दिल्ली के कई हिस्सों जैसे लक्ष्मी नगर, ITO और दक्षिण दिल्ली के कुछ इलाकों में भी सड़कों पर पानी जलभराव देखने को मिला, जिससे ट्रैफिक जाम की स्थिति बन गई.
IMD के मुताबिक दिल्ली-NCR में अगले कुछ घंटों तक बारिश का सिलसिला जारी रह सकता है. आईएमडी ने पूरे दिल्ली-एनसीआर में रेड अलर्ट जारी किया है. लोगों से अपील की गई है कि वे जलभराव वाले इलाकों से बचें और ट्रैफिक अपडेट्स पर नजर रखें.
By clicking “Accept All Cookies”, you agree to the storing of cookies on your device to enhance site navigation, analyze site usage, and assist in our marketing efforts.

title: भारत मंडपम के सामने जलभराव: भारी बारिश से सुबह-सुबह सड़कें बनी दरिया; तस्वीरों में देखें राजधानी का हाल - Amar Ujala
article_text:
भारत मंडपम के सामने जलभराव: भारी बारिश से सुबह-सुबह सड़कें बनी दरिया; तस्वीरों में देखें राजधानी का हाल
अमर उजाला नेटवर्क, नई दिल्ली Published by: अनुज कुमार Updated Sat, 09 Aug 2025 09:53 AM IST
सार
दिल्ली समेत नोएडा, गाजियाबाद शहरों में शनिवार सुबह से ही लगातार बारिश हो रही है। रक्षा बंधन के त्योहार पर बारिश के बीच जलभराव हो गया है। भारत मंडपम के सामने जल भराव हो गया है। जिसके बाद अंडरपास को बंद कर दिया है। सुबह हुई तेज बारिश ने सरकार की तैयारियों की पोल खोलकर रख दी। 
भारत मंडपम के सामने जल भराव - फोटो : X @ANI
दिल्ली-एनसीआर में आज सुबह से ही भारी बारिश हो रही है। तेज बारिश से  दिल्ली और नोएडा के कई हिस्सों में जलभराव हो गया है। लगातार बारिश के चलते शहर के कई इलाकों में भारी जलभराव हो गया है। मौसम विभाग के अनुसार अगले कुछ घंटे तक लगातार बारिश को लेकर चेतावनी जारी की है।

title: Delhi-NCR hit by heavy rain: Flights delayed, streets flooded as IMD warns of more thunderstorms - The Economic Times
article_text:
PTI
Heavy rain swept across parts of Delhi and the National Capital Region on Saturday morning, disrupting flights and soaking the morning commute. Flight tracking site Flightradar reported roughly 90 flight delays and four cancellations due to poor weather conditions.

Shastri Bhawan, R.K. Puram, Moti Bagh, and Kidwai Nagar saw some of the heaviest showers. On Mathura Road and outside Bharat Mandapam’s Gate No. 7, water pooled quickly, slowing vehicles and forcing pedestrians to wade through knee-deep patches.

Artificial Intelligence

AI For Business Professionals Batch 2

By Ansh Mehra


View Program 



— ANI (@ANI)


More showers expected in the Capital
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) forecast for the day warned of “thunderstorm with rain”, with temperatures expected to peak at 33°C and drop to 25°C at night. Officials have cautioned that the capital could see another round of showers later in the day.


Himachal Pradesh on high rain alert
Separately, the IMD has sounded an orange alert for August 11 and 12 in three districts of Himachal Pradesh, warning of heavy rain. The rest of the state is under a yellow alert. The department said, “Heavy rainfall activity is expected to continue in many parts of the State over the next few days.”

The ongoing monsoon has already proved deadly. Since June 20, official data show 202 deaths from rain-related incidents. Of these, 108 were caused by rain, floods, and landslides, while 94 resulted from road accidents.



Rainfall far above seasonal average
The IMD reports that August rainfall in Himachal is currently 35% above normal. Solan, Kullu, Kinnaur, Bilaspur, and Una have recorded almost double their usual levels. From June 1 to August 8, the state has seen 13% more rain than the seasonal average.


Shimla has logged the highest rainfall, with Mandi following closely at 65% above normal. Chamba, Una, Bilaspur, and Kangra have each recorded around 40% more rainfall than usual.


Despite these figures, no major flood warnings have been issued so far. Rain in some regions has been lighter in recent days, which officials say has helped ease the immediate risk.

title: Weather Alert: Heavy Rain and Waterlogging Disrupt Delhi Traffic - Deccan Herald
article_text:
New Delhi: Heavy rain lashed the national capital Saturday morning, affecting traffic in several parts of the city due to waterlogging in several places.
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a red alert for most parts of Delhi-NCR.
Waterlogging at Panchkuian Marg, Mathura Road, Shastri Bhawan, RK Puram, Moti Bagh, Kidwai Nagar, among others, slowed down traffic in the area.
The downpour began late night around 11 pm on Friday and has continued till Saturday morning.
The IMD has issued a red alert for heavy rainfall accompanied by lightning and thunderstorms for parts of North, West, South, South East, and Central Delhi districts for the day.

title: Delhi rain live updates: Waterlogging in several areas, building collapse in Jaitpur - Hindustan Times
article_text:
Subscribe Now! Get features like
Delhi rain live updates: Heavy rain lashed Delhi on Saturday morning, disrupting traffic in several parts of the city and affecting the air travel due to the bad weather. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert for most parts of Delhi-NCR. Several areas in the capital, including Panchkuian Marg, Mathura Road, Shastri Bhawan, RK Puram, Moti Bagh and Kidwai Nagar reported waterlogging, slowed down traffic in the area. The downpour began late night around 11 pm on Friday and has continued till Saturday morning....Read More
The IMD has issued a red alert for heavy rainfall accompanied by lightning and thunderstorms for parts of North, West, South, South East, and Central Delhi districts for the day.
Delhi rain live updates: Indigo on Saturday advised passenger to plan their airport trip well in advance and prefer alternate routes amid heavy rain in the capital. “Due to today’s downpour, several roads across Delhi are currently blocked or experiencing slow movement. Please allow extra time, take an alternate route if possible, and check your flight status on our website or app before leaving for the airport,” Indigo said in a statement on X.
Delhi rain live updates: Delhi Fire Services has said they have received a call regarding a portion of a building collapsed at Hari Nagar, Jaitpur in South East Delhi. Two fire engines have been sent to the spot.
Delhi rain live updates: Delhi Airport has urged passengers to arrive well in advance and consider alternative transport options, such as the Delhi Metro, amid waterlogging in the capital.
“As per the Indian Meteorological Department's forecast, Delhi is currently experiencing inclement weather, including heavy rainfall resulting in waterlogging near the airport. Passengers are advised to plan their travel accordingly and consider alternative modes of transport, such as the Delhi Metro, to avoid delays and ensure timely arrival at the airport,” the advisory of the Delhi Airport said.
Delhi rain live updates: Several areas of the capital, including ITO, Connaught Place and Mathura road were waterlogged after overnight rain. The visuals from ANI showed waterlogging outside Bharat Mandapam Convention Centre.
Delhi Rain Live Updates: The traffic police said that the traffic has been affected at Zakhira Railway Underpass due to waterlogging. It also said that the traffic from Shastri Nagar/KD Chowk is being diverted towards Chaudhary Nahar Singh Marg.
Delhi Rain Live Updates: The Delhi Traffic Police said that the traffic may be affected on Lodhi Road in the carriageway from Madarsa towards Lodhi Hotel due to bending of a tree towards the road near Lodhi Garden. In a later post, the police said that the tree has been removed.
Delhi Rain Live Updates: The Delhi Traffic Police on Saturday said the traffic from Ashok Park Main Metro Station is being diverted towards Punjabi Bagh due to waterlogging at New Rohtak road. “Due to water logging at Gali No. 10, Anand Parbat, New Rohtak road, Traffic is being diverted towards Sarai Rohilla. Further, traffic is also being diverted from Ashok Park Main Metro Station towards Punjabi Bagh,” the advisory read.
Delhi Rain Live Updates: The IMD has issued a red alert for most parts of Delhi-NCR. The downpour began late night around 11 pm on Friday and has continued till Saturday morning.

title: Heavy rain batters Delhi on Raksha Bandhan, waterlogging in many parts of city - National Herald
article_text:
The national capital was lashed by heavy rain overnight, causing waterlogging in several areas early in the morning of Raksha Bandhan, with more showers expected during the day.
Early on Saturday morning, the India Meteorological Department issued a red alert for heavy rain with lightning and thunderstorms for parts of north, west, south, southeast, and Central Delhi, but later downgraded to a yellow alert, advising people to be aware.
In the 24 hours till 8.30 am on Saturday, Delhi's primary weather station at Safdarjung recorded 78.7 mm of rainfall, Pragati Maidan 100 mm, Lodhi Road 80 mm, Pusa 69 mm, and Palam 31.8 mm, according to data shared by the weather department.
The downpour began late at 11 pm on Friday, lashing multiple parts of Delhi-NCR, including Panchkuian Marg, Mathura Road, Shastri Bhawan, RK Puram, Moti Bagh, Kidwai Nagar, and several other areas.
The temperature was recorded at 23.8 degrees Celsius on Saturday morning, 3.2 notches below the average, while the maximum temperature is expected to settle around 32 degrees Celsius.

title: Roads Waterlogged, Over 100 Flights Delayed As Delhi-NCR Witnesses Heavy Rain, Red Alert Issued - News18
article_text:
Roads Waterlogged, Over 100 Flights Delayed As Delhi-NCR Witnesses Heavy Rain, Red Alert Issued
Curated By :
Anushka Vats
News18.com
Last Updated:
August 09, 2025, 08:29 IST
The India Meteorological Department has predicted more showers for today.
Follow us on:
Delhi-NCR received rain on on Saturday

Heavy rain lashed Delhi-NCR on Saturday, leaving several areas waterlogged. The downpour also affected flight operations, with more than 90 flights being delayed and four cancelled.

RECOMMENDED STORIES
Triple Murder In Delhi: Man Kills Wife, Two Daughters; Police Launch Probe
Raksha Bandhan 2025: Delhi Traffic Police Issues Advisory As Capital Sees Rakhi Rush
Parents Hire Detective To Spy On DU Student, Find Her Near Brothel: ‘So Aniruddhacharya Was Right’
Bihar Man Disguised As Sadhu, Returns After 10 Years, Kills Estranged Wife With Hammer

Waterlogging was witnessed on Mathura Road following, and also at Bharat Mandapam’s Gate no. 7 after light rain in the early hours of Saturday.

#WATCH | Delhi | Heavy rain causes waterlogging at the Panchkuian Marg pic.twitter.com/nldjJHoqhI— ANI (@ANI) August 9, 2025

The IMD has predicted “thunderstorm with rain" for Thursday. The maximum temperature is likely to settle at 33 degrees Celsius, and the minimum temperature is expected to be recorded at 25 degrees Celsius.

#WATCH | Delhi | Heavy rain lashes several parts of the National Capital(Visuals from RK Puram) pic.twitter.com/bTUsqN12yj

— ANI (@ANI) August 9, 2025

Red And Yellow Alert Issued

The Indian Meteorological Department has issued a red alert in parts of Delhi, including in North Delhi, West Delhi, South Delhi, South.

The weather department has also issued Yellow alert for some places, including Ghaziabad, parts of east Delhi, and Noida for today, August 9.

IndiGo Issues Travel Advisory

IndiGo issued a travel advisory asking its passengers to take an alternate route in case they find a road blocked due to rain.

“Heads up, #Delhi travellers! Due to today’s downpour, several roads across Delhi are currently blocked or experiencing slow movement. Please allow extra time, take an alternate route if possible, and check your flight status on our website or app before leaving for the airport," it said on X.

“Our teams are working to keep things on track and support your journey. Thank you for continued trust and patience," it added.

Rain Alert For Other Regions

Besides Delhi, the weather department has also issued a fresh warning of continued rainfall activity in Himachal Pradesh, with heavy rain expected in many parts of the state over the next few days.

TOP VIDEOS
VIEW ALL

An orange alert is in place for August 11 and 12 in three districts and a Yellow Alert for the remaining districts.

title: Heavy rain in Delhi-NCR leaves several areas waterlogged, 90 flights delayed - MSN
article_text:
Overnight heavy rain across Delhi-NCR left several areas heavily waterlogged on Saturday, bringing the national capital to a standstill. Flight operations were also affected, with data from Flightradar showing around 90 flights were delayed and four cancelled.
"As per the IMD forecast, Delhi is experiencing inclement weather conditions. However, all flight operations are currently normal," an advisory by the IGI Airport in Delhi stated.
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) had predicted heavy rainfall and thunderstorms through the morning.

Heavy rain batters Delhi, waterlogging in many parts of city

NEW DELHI: (Aug 9) Heavy rain lashed the national capital Saturday morning, affecting traffic in several parts of the city due to waterlogging in several places.

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a red alert for most parts of Delhi-NCR.

Waterlogging at Panchkuian Marg, Mathura Road, Shastri Bhawan, RK Puram, Moti Bagh, Kidwai Nagar, among others, slowed down traffic in the area.

title: Red alert issued as Delhi-NCR witnesses heavy rain, waterlogging in places - MSN
article_text:
Delhi woke up to heavy rain that triggered waterlogging in parts of the city, disrupting traffic. Rain lashed several parts of Delhi-NCR, including Shastri Bhawan, RK Puram, Moti Bagh, and Kidwai Nagar. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert in the city for the day.
Indian Meteorological Department has issued a red alert in Delhi, including in North Delhi, West Delhi, South Delhi, South East Delhi and Central Delhi for very heavy rainfall accompanied by lightning and thunderstorm. Waterlogging was witnessed at Panchkuian Marg, Minto Road and Mathura Road following heavy rain, as well as Bharat Mandapam's Gate no. 7, which was waterlogged in the early hours of Saturday, ANI reported.
Also read: Delhi rain: Over 100 flights delayed, traffic disrupted as heavy rain brings capital to standstill
For the Delhi NCR area, a red alert has been issued in Ghaziabad, while a yellow alert has been issued in Gautambudhnagar for thunderstorms and lightning.

title: Air India, IndiGo issue travel advisory amid heavy rainfall in Delhi - The Economic Times
article_text:
ANI
Representative image
Air India and IndiGo on Saturday issued travel advisory to passengers travelling to and from Delhi amid heavy rainfall. The Delhi Airport also issued a passenger advisory for passengers to use alternate commute like the Delhi Metro to avoid delays as areas near the airport have been waterlogged. It also advised passengers to check flight status with the respective airlines.

Delhi rains cause flight delays and cacelations
Heavy rain swept across parts of Delhi and the National Capital Region on Saturday morning, disrupting flights and morning commute. Flight tracking site Flightradar reported about 90 flight delays and four cancellations due to poor weather conditions.


Meanwhile, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) forecast for the day warned of “thunderstorm with rain”, with temperatures expected to peak at 33°C and drop to 25°C at night. Officials have cautioned that the capital could see another round of showers later in the day.


Shastri Bhawan, R.K. Puram, Moti Bagh, and Kidwai Nagar saw some of the heaviest showers. On Mathura Road and outside Bharat Mandapam’s Gate No. 7, water pooled quickly, slowing vehicles and forcing pedestrians to wade through knee-deep patches.

title: Cloudburst In Himachal Pradesh's Kullu, Yellow Alert Issued For Several Districts - News18
article_text:
Cloudburst In Himachal Pradesh's Kullu, Yellow Alert Issued For Several Districts
Curated By :
Anushka Vats
News18.com
Last Updated:
August 09, 2025, 10:10 IST
A yellow alert is also in place for several areas, including the Kangra, Una, and Sirmaur districts.
Follow us on:
ADVERTISEMENT
Ad
Cloudburst reported in Kullu (Credits: X)

A cloudburst incident was reported in Himachal Pradesh’s Kullu on Friday, according to the information provided by the Central Water Commission, Mohal.

RECOMMENDED STORIES
SP Leader ST Hasan Stokes Controversy, Links Uttarakhand Tragedy To Religious Intolerance'
Raksha Bandhan 2025: 12 Years Without A Rakhi... Sister Across The Border, Brothers Wait In Barmer
One Student Killed, 11 Injured After Tomato-Laden Tempo Mows Them Down In Nashik
Cheetahs Breeding Better Than Expected, Says Bhupender Yadav; Lists Climate Change Goals | Exclusive

So far, no reports of loss of life have been received. According to the District Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) Kullu, the situation remains under control and is currently normal.

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) also issued a heavy rain alert for several districts of Himachal Pradesh. A yellow alert is also in place for several areas, including the Kangra, Una, and Sirmaur districts.

“On August 9, a Yellow Alert has been issued for Kangra, Una, and Sirmaur districts for heavy rainfall. Rainfall activity is expected to pick up again from the night of August 10 and continue through the morning of August 11," Sandeep Kumar Sharma, Senior Scientist at the IMD Shimla Centre told ANI.

ADVETISEMENT

As many as 357 roads have been blocked, 599 power distribution transformers (DTRs) are out of service, and 177 water supply schemes have been affected due to heavy rain, according to the State Emergency Operation Centre (SEOC).

According to the latest figures from the State Disaster Management Authority (SDMA), the state has reported a total of 208 monsoon-related deaths so far. Of these, 112 fatalities were caused by rain-induced disasters such as landslides, flash floods, and house collapses. The remaining 96 deaths occurred in road accidents, many of which are believed to have been worsened by poor visibility and slippery conditions during the monsoon.

Mandi district has been the worst affected in the state, reporting the highest number of road blockages and power outages — 206 and 204 respectively. The heavy rainfall has also severely impacted water supply systems in the region, with 105 schemes disrupted.

(With ANI inputs)

Home  > News > State > Andhra Pradesh
Heavy rains forecasted for three days in Telangana, alert issued
Pavan Bandari
Hans News Service | 9 Aug 2025 9:48 AM IST
HIGHLIGHTS
Hyderabad has once again been besieged by heavy rains, with downpours commencing at midnight and leaving many residents anxious.

Hyderabad has once again been besieged by heavy rains, with downpours commencing at midnight and leaving many residents anxious. Significant water stagnation was reported across the city, particularly in areas such as Old Town, Charminar, and Chandrayangutta, while Bahadurpura, Gowliguda, Shalibanda, Saidabad, Malakpet, Chadarghat, and Yusufguda experienced severe inundation. Further rainfall was recorded in Bandlaguda, Nampally, and Amberpet, prompting local authorities to remain on high alert.

The Meteorological Department has indicated that ongoing surface depression in the Bay of Bengal is likely to result in continued heavy rainfall over the next three days across the state. Residents are advised to remain vigilant in response to the weather warning.

In addition, floodwaters from the Himayatsagar have begun to affect traffic, with water levels rising to the point that authorities have closed roads near the ORR exit number 17. Police have erected barricades in the area and are urging motorists travelling from Gachibowli to Shamshabad to seek alternative routes.

A yellow alert has been issued for the districts of Nagarkurnool, Wanaparthy, and Gadwal, with predictions of another low-pressure system forming in the Bay of Bengal on the 13th, bringing moderate rainfall across many areas of Andhra Pradesh and heavier precipitation expected in the Rayalaseema region.

title: UP Weather Update: यूपी में मॉनसून के बीच बाढ़ का खतरनाक रूप... इन 11 जिलों में Flash Flood की चेतावनी जारी - UP Tak
article_text:
होम
अपना यूपी
up weather update floods take a dangerous form in up amidst monsoon flash flood warning issued in these 11 districts
UP Weather Update: यूपी में मॉनसून के बीच बाढ़ का खतरनाक रूप... इन 11 जिलों में Flash Flood की चेतावनी जारी
UP Weather Update: मौसम विभाग ने 9 अगस्त के लिए यूपी के 11 जिलों में Flash Flood की चेतावनी जारी की है. इसके अलावा, कई जिलों में भयंकर बारिश का रेड अलर्ट जारी किया गया है.

UP Weather Update

यूपी तक

09 Aug 2025 (अपडेटेड: 09 Aug 2025, 06:51 AM)

Subscribe to Notifications

UP Weather Update: उत्तर प्रदेश में मॉनसून का कहर अब बाढ़ के रूप में सामने आ रहा है. मौसम विभाग ने कल यानी 9 अगस्त के लिए कई जिलों में भारी बारिश के साथ-साथ बाढ़ का ऑरेंज अलर्ट भी जारी किया है. खास तौर पर गोंडा, बहराइच, लखीमपुर खीरी और सीतापुर जैसे जिलों में बहुत भारी बारिश का रेड अलर्ट जारी होने से बाढ़ की आशंका और बढ़ गई है. 

ADVERTISEMENT

पूरा लेख पढ़ें
यह भी पढ़ें...
UP Weather Update: यूपी में 9 जून को मॉनसूनी बारिश का डेंजर अटैक... इन 6 जिलों में रेड, 14 में ऑरेंज और 33 में येलो अलर्ट जारी

Aug 9 2025 6:40 AM

डालडा से बनाया गया 923 लीटर नकली घी संभल में बरामद... प्रवीण जैन के घर पर बन रहा था 'जहर'

Aug 8 2025 9:21 PM

मऊ में फर्जी नियुक्ति के आरोप में 86 पर केस, 42 शिक्षकों की सैलरी रोक दी गई! यूपी में हड़कंप मचाने वाला ये पूरा मामला समझिए

Aug 8 2025 7:39 PM

पहली बार चलाई गई 4.5 किलोमीटर लंबी गुड्स ट्रेन, देखें 354 वैगन वाली इस रुद्रास्त्र ने कैसे रचा इतिहास

Aug 8 2025 7:03 PM

UP Weather Update: यूपी में 9 अगस्त को मॉनसून का खतरा... मौसम विभाग ने इन 39 जिलों में डरावनी बारिश की चेतावनी जारी की 

Aug 8 2025 12:37 PM

उत्तरकाशी के धराली में जहां बादल फटा वहां मौजूद थे संभल के सलमान और फुरकान, आखिरी समय ये करते हुए देखे गए

Aug 8 2025 11:31 AM

UP Weather Update: यूपी में मॉनसून की डरावनी वापसी... इस डेट से फिर होगी खतरनाक बारिश, मौसम विभाग ने की भविष्यवाणी

Aug 8 2025 10:38 AM

पश्चिम बंगाल की नरगिस खातून ने ऐसा क्या किया कि देवरिया की 10वीं छात्रा घर से हो गई गायब! परिवार वालों ने सुनाई ये कहानी

Aug 8 2025 10:12 AM

यूपी में 3 नई प्राइवेट यूनिवर्सिटी बनाए जाने का रास्ता साफ, बाराबंकी, मुजफ्फरनगर और मथुरा में बनेंगे ये विश्वविद्यालय

Aug 8 2025 8:31 AM

UP Weather Update: यूपी में मॉनसून की तेज रफ्तार... आज 8 जिलों में हैवी रेन का रेड अलर्ट, 40+ जगहों पर आंधी-तूफान और बारिश, स्कूलों में छुट्टियां

Aug 8 2025 7:52 AM

प्रशासन और लोगों की चिंता इसलिए भी बढ़ गई है क्योंकि अमेठी, अयोध्या और लखनऊ समेत 11 जिलों के कुछ इलाकों में आकस्मिक बाढ़ (Flash Flood) का खतरा बताया गया है. 

9 अगस्त के लिए जिलेवार अलर्ट

बाढ़ का खतरा (ऑरेंज अलर्ट): अमेठी, अयोध्या, बाराबंकी, हरदोई, जौनपुर, लखनऊ, प्रतापगढ़, रायबरेली, सीतापुर, सुल्तानपुर और उन्नाव के कुछ जलग्रहण क्षेत्रों में.

बहुत भारी बारिश (रेड अलर्ट): गोंडा, बहराइच, लखीमपुर खीरी, सीतापुर, बाराबंकी और अयोध्या.

भारी बारिश (ऑरेंज अलर्ट): प्रयागराज, प्रतापगढ़, संत रविदास नगर, जौनपुर, बस्ती, श्रावस्ती, हरदोई, अमेठी, सुल्तानपुर, अम्बेडकरनगर, रामपुर, बरेली, पीलीभीत और शाहजहांपुर.

भारी वर्षा (येलो अलर्ट): बांदा, चित्रकूट, कौशाम्बी, फतेहपुर, मिर्जापुर, वाराणसी, सिद्धार्थनगर, बलरामपुर, फरुखाबाद, कन्नौज, कानपुर देहात, कानपुर नगर, उन्नाव, लखनऊ, रायबरेली, सहारनपुर, कासगंज, एटा, आगरा, फिरोजाबाद, मैनपुरी, इटावा, औरैया, बिजनौर, अमरोहा, मुरादाबाद, संभल, बदायूं, जालौन, हमीरपुर, महोबा और झांसी.

इसके अलावा, इन सभी जिलों में मेघगर्जन और बिजली गिरने (वज्रपात) की भी आशंका है। लोगों को सलाह दी गई है कि वे जलभराव और बाढ़ प्रभावित इलाकों से दूर रहें.

ये भी पढ़ें: UP Weather Update: यूपी में मॉनसून की डरावनी वापसी... इस डेट से फिर होगी खतरनाक बारिश, मौसम विभाग ने की भविष्यवाणी

title: झारखंड में भारी बारिश का ऑरेंज अलर्ट, 12 अगस्त से फिर सक्रिय होगा मॉनसून - Johar LIVE
article_text:
Share

Ranchi : झारखंड में पिछले डेढ़ महीने से जारी बारिश के बीच अब मॉनसून कमजोर हुआ है, जिससे कई इलाकों में बाढ़ जैसे हालात से राहत मिली है। हालांकि, मौसम विभाग ने कोल्हान के जिलों में शनिवार के लिए भारी बारिश का ऑरेंज अलर्ट जारी किया है। विभाग के अनुसार, शुक्रवार रात से शनिवार दोपहर तक कुछ जगहों पर अत्यंत भारी बारिश हो सकती है।

राजधानी रांची समेत राज्य के अन्य हिस्सों में हल्की से मध्यम बारिश होने की संभावना है। मौसम विभाग का अनुमान है कि 12 अगस्त के बाद पूरे राज्य में मानसून की सक्रियता बढ़ेगी और अधिकांश क्षेत्रों में अच्छी बारिश होगी।

विशेषज्ञों के अनुसार, बंगाल की खाड़ी के मध्य से उत्तरी हिस्से तक निम्न दबाव क्षेत्र बनने की प्रक्रिया शुरू हो गई है, जबकि बांग्लादेश और पश्चिम बंगाल के तटीय क्षेत्रों में साइक्लोनिक सर्कुलेशन सक्रिय है, जिससे राज्य में बारिश के अनुकूल परिस्थितियां बनी हुई हैं।

बारिश

title: MP Weather Update: रक्षाबंधन के दिन होगी भारी बारिश, 9 जिलों के लिए अलर्ट जारी, घर से निकलने से पहले जानें मौसम का हाल - IBC24 News
article_text:
MP Weather Update | Image Credit: IBC24 File

भोपाल: MP Weather Update देश के कई राज्यों में इस समय जमकर बारिश हो रही है। कई हिस्सों में बारिश की वजह से जन जीवन अस्तव्यस्त हो गया है। तो वहीं दूसरी ओर बारिश का पानी सड़कों पर भर गया है। जिससे आवाजाही पूरी तरह से प्रभावित हो गई है। बात करें मध्यप्रदेश की तो यहां एक सप्ताह बाद एक बार फिर बारिश का दौर शुरू हो चुका है। आज यानी रक्षाबंधन के दिन भी कई हिस्सों में बारिश हो रही है। इसी बीच मौसम विभाग ने कई हिस्सों के लिए बारिश की चेतावनी दी है।

Read More: World’s Best Airlines 2025: ये हैं दुनिया की 10 सबसे शानदार एयरलाइंस.. क्या भारत की कोई कंपनी है लिस्ट में? देखें..

MP Weather Update मौसम विभाग के अनुसार, आज मध्यप्रदेश के 9 जिलों में तेज बारिश हो सकती है। वहीं इंदौर और उज्जैन संभाग के 15 में से 13 जिलों में तेज धूप खिलेगी। भोपाल, ग्वालियर-जबलपुर में भी हल्के बादल छाए रह सकते हैं। इससे पहले शुक्रवार को भी सीधी, मंडला समेत 10 जिलों में बारिश हुई।

Read More: Rakhi Shubh Muhurat 2025: रक्षाबंधन पर राहु का साया, राखी बांधने के लिए बहनों को मिलेगा मात्र इतना समय, आप भी जानें शुभ मुहूर्त

आज इन जिलों में अलर्ट

मौसम विभाग ने आज शनिवार को श्योपुर, मुरैना, पन्ना, कटनी, अनूपपुर, डिंडौरी, मंडला, सिवनी और बालाघाट में तेज बारिश होने का अलर्ट जारी किया है। दूसरी ओर, इंदौर, उज्जैन, नीमच, मंदसौर, रतलाम, देवास, खंडवा, बुरहानपुर, खरगोन, धार, बड़वानी, अलीराजपुर और झाबुआ में मौसम साफ रहेगा। बाकी जिलों में गरज-चमक और हल्की बारिश का यलो अलर्ट है।

बलिया7 घंटे पहले

बलिया| बाढ़ ग्रसित क्षेत्र शादीपुर दियारा में शुक्रवार की अहले सुबह सर्पदंश से एक वृद्धा की मौत हो गयी। मृतक की पहचान प्रखंड क्षेत्र के शादीपुर दियारा बरैय टोला निवासी सोगरथ भगत के 60 बर्षीय पत्नी उषा देवी करायी गयी है । घटना के संबंध में परिजनों ने ब

अधूरा नहीं! पढ़िए पूरा!पढ़ें पूरी खबर दैनिक भास्कर ऐप पर

title: Weather Update: अभी नहीं मिलेगी राहत... प्रदेश के 30 जिलों में भारी बारिश की चेतावनी जारी - Amar Ujala
article_text:
UP: यूपी में भारी मानसूनी बारिश जारी... 24 जिले बाढ़ की चपेट में, अभी एक हफ्ता राहत की उम्मीद नहीं
अमर उजाला ब्यूरो, लखनऊ Published by: ishwar ashish Updated Sat, 09 Aug 2025 09:01 AM IST
सार
148529 Followers
लखनऊ
उत्तर से दक्षिण तक भारी बारिश का दौर जारी है फिलहाल इससे राहत के आसार नहीं हैं। वहीं, मौसम विभाग ने प्रदेश के 30 जिलों में भारी बारिश की चेतावनी जारी की है।
बाराबंकी के सुंदरनगर गांव में पानी भरने के बाद सुरक्षित स्थान पर जाते ग्रामीण। - फोटो : amar ujala
1
विस्तार
Follow Us

उत्तर प्रदेश के विभिन्न इलाकों में भारी मानसूनी बारिश लगातार जारी है। प्रयागराज, वाराणसी, बदायूं, उन्नाव, कानपुर समेत उत्तर से दक्षिण तक प्रदेश के लगभग 24 जिले बाढ़ की चपेट में हैं। मौसम विभाग की मानें तो बारिश से फिलहाल एक हफ्ते राहत की उम्मीद नहीं है।

और पढ़ें

Car swept away in floodwaters after tank breach
The Hans India
Hans News Service | 9 Aug 2025 7:22 AM IST
HIGHLIGHTS
Passengers escape unharmed

Choutuppal ( Yadadri-Bhongir): Travelers had a Providential escape when the car that they were traveling in was swept away in the floodwaters at Nelapatla–Verkutpally road in Choutuppal mandal after a village tank overflowed and its bund breached due to heavy rains on Thursday night.

According to reports, four individuals from Choutuppal were returning from Workutpally to Choutuppal by car when the incident occurred. As they approached Nelapatla, they encountered a sudden gush of water caused by the breach of a nearby tank.

Sensing the danger, all four occupants quickly exited the vehicle just in time. Within moments, the car was swept away by the strong floodwaters.

Fortunately, there was no loss of life.

Locals and authorities have been alerted, and officials are assessing the situation.

The incident highlights the risks posed by sudden floods and the need for timely maintenance of local water bodies, especially during the monsoon season.
